author: SUBMITTED
title: Annual Back-to-School Bash & Free Cookout is Thursday at Raymond Head Jr. Park | News | griffindailynews.com
text:
GRIFFIN ‚Äî Celebrate the start of the 2025-2026 school year with the City of Griffin Police Department and Griffin Fire Rescue at the annual Back-to-School Bash & Free Cookout, happening Thursday, July 24, from 5-7 p.m. at Raymond Head Park, 1012 Beck Street, right across from the new Griffin Police Southside Precinct and Community Center that opened in April.
Now in its third year, this free event offers students and families an evening of fun, food, and valuable resources. The first 300 students, ranging from elementary to high school, will receive a free backpack filled with school supplies. In addition, attendees can enjoy complimentary hotdog plates, popcorn, face painting, games, prize giveaways, and more.

author: Celina Lozano
title: Not Even Elsa Could Make this Cold! The Freezing Temperatures in the U.S. are Sparking Chaos
text:
More than 87 million people across the United States are on high alert due to an intense Arctic cold wave . Temperatures have plunged up to 28¬∞C below average , with meteorologists warning that the drop could reach as much as 30¬∞C‚Äîshattering 270 records in at least 27 states .
The extreme chill has forced Arkansas, North Carolina, and Virginia to declare states of emergency as temperatures hit critical levels. This brutal cold snap has also unleashed heavy snowfall, freezing rain, and significant ice buildup, severely disrupting mobility throughout the country and tragically claiming 17 lives .
Which Areas Are Most Affected by the Extreme Cold? Read also: Could Donald Trump‚Äôs Decisions Be the Dark Link to the Recent Aviation Accidents?
North Dakota and Montana: Dangerous wind chills capable of freezing skin in minutes. In Bismarck, North Dakota, the coldest day in over 16 years was recorded. Arkansas, North Carolina, and Virginia: States of emergency have been declared in response to the extreme winter conditions. Texas: Several cities are experiencing record low temperatures, with differences of up to 45¬∞C between the northern and southern parts of the state. Kentucky and Virginia: These states have reported most of the 15 deaths linked to the winter storm, primarily due to hypothermia. Disruptions in Transportation, Energy, and Daily Life Read also: HAARP Project: A Conspiracy Theory About The Apocalyptic Weapon Behind the Worst Natural Disasters üö®üá∫üá∏ Meanwhile in Detroit, US
Holy crap ‚Äì first Detroit flooded & then it froze ‚ÄºÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/NKq7dfUTDi
‚Äî Concerned Citizen (@BGatesIsaPyscho) February 19, 2025
The storm has caused severe interruptions along major transportation routes. Highways, such as Interstate 44 in Oklahoma and Missouri, have been shut down. Hazardous weather conditions have led to the cancellation of more than 5,000 flights in recent days , along with thousands of delays across various states.
Read also: A Bizarre Earthquake Hits Military Base At Area 51 and Here‚Äôs What We Know
Additionally, the surge in electricity demand‚Äîdriven by the heavy use of heating‚Äîhas affected thousands of households, leading to blackouts and energy shortages in states experiencing never-before-seen temperatures.
In response to these treacherous cold conditions, numerous school districts in both the eastern and parts of the western United States have canceled in-person classes in favor of virtual learning, citing the risk that freezing temperatures and dangerous driving conditions pose to children and their families.
Every year, winter storms in the United States cause losses exceeding $1.2 billion. Moreover, perilous road conditions result in approximately 1,000 deaths and leave more than 100,000 people injured.
This article was originally written in Spanish by Natalia Rodriguez in Ecoosfera.

author: Dave H Posts
title: Mycodes and attachments stopped working after upgrade.
text:
2 hours ago
The latest in my ongoing attempts to upgrade from 1.6.13 to 1.8.38:
After days of trying to update on the webserver, I finally gave up and took the backup and read it into a local linux machine and loaded myBB 1.8.38 and performed the update. Then I dumped the resulting SQL DB and reloaded it back into the web server. At first glance this seemed to work pretty good.
(I do recall being alarmed when I saw a message "Adding index files to attachment directories" but hoped for the best, because I think it was too late anyway.)
However, in the upgraded 1.8.38 version:
mycodes in posts don't work. ie: posts that used to be properly formatted are now displayed with [b][/size][/font] etc. showing.
Attachments seem gone - there are no indicators in the forum, and I see mycode-style text instead like:
[attachment=14398][attachment=14399][attachment=14400][attachment=14401][attachment=14402]
Thank you for any clues.

[attachment=14398][attachment=14399][attachment=14400][attachment=14401][attachment=14402]
Thank you for any clues.

author: Bhushan Akolkar
title: Ethereum ETF Flows Flip Negative Again As ETH Price Slips 6%, What‚Äôs Next?
text:
Highlights
- US Spot Ethereum ETF recorded an outflow of $3.24 million on November 14, breaking its six-day inflow streak.
- Grayscale Ethereum ETF (ETHE) led the outflows with nearly $22 million with BlackRock ETHA offsetting it.
- ETH price dropped 6% in the past 24 hours to $3,000, erasing over $22 billion in market capitalization.
- Analyst highlight a re-entry opportunity at Supertrend support just around $3,000 levels.
After six consecutive days of inflows, the spot Ethereum ETF flows flipped negative again on Thursday, as the bullish sentiment driven by Trump-trade subsided. The ETH price also dropped 6% in the last 24 hours moving all the way to $3,000 losing over $22 billion in market cap.
Spot Ethereum ETF Flips Negative
After six consecutive days of inflows, the US Spot Ethereum ETF is once again seeing outflows. On November 14, Ethereum ETFs experienced a minor outflow of $3.24 million, the first since the Donald Trump victory on November 5.
Despite this, BlackRock‚Äôs Ethereum ETF (ETHA) saw a net inflow of $18.87 million in a single day. However, Grayscale‚Äôs ETHE played the spoilsport with nearly $22 million in outflows yesterday. Besides, inflows in other Ether ETFs have dried up significantly, as per the data from SoSoValue.
Following the Donald Trump victory on November 5, the spot Ether ETFs saw strong inflows as the ETH price rallied 40% on the weekly timeframe all the way to $3,400. However, since the November top, the ETH price has corrected nearly 10% as bulls try to defend $3,000 levels.
ETH Price Action in Choppy Market
Amid the recent ETH price action, popular crypto trader Credibull Crypto has started to build a position in Ethereum (ETH) and add further if Ethereum drops to $2,800, amid the current low-time-frame (LTF) price action and crypto market drop. The decision to increase their exposure is based on Bitcoin‚Äôs recent stability, which may prevent a quick pullback to the low $80k range and allow ETH to continue upward.
The trader notes that a small range is forming, pushing into local demand, with untapped local highs above. They are eyeing potential gains toward the $3,500+ level before reassessing. However, the trader emphasizes that the invalidation point for their higher-time-frame (TF) ETH strategy is at $2,350.
Watching this LTF PA develop on
[$ETH]and have started positioning here. If we make it down to the ideal entry zone (sub $2800) I'll add to my position.Reason for going in more aggressively here is that BTC is holding up decently atm and if we don't get a pullback to low 80k's‚Ä¶
[pic.twitter.com/TmwCxBLgbu]‚Äî CrediBULL Crypto (@CredibleCrypto)
[November 14, 2024]
Popular trading account IncomeSharks suggests that traders who missed the initial entry opportunity might find a second chance near Supertrend support just under $3,000. The trader also added that the swift shift in market sentiment, as ‚Äúa few red candles‚Äù have led to widespread pessimism and negativity toward the asset. However, he believes that there‚Äôs a strong potential for a rebound moving ahead. This can again lead to resuming the inflows for spot Ethereum ETFs.
A recent Ethereum price analysis hints that analysts have been making bullish predictions for the crypto, potentially hitting $4,000, by November end. However, it will require the support of the broader market to continue this rally ahead.
